definition: place where the emperor listened to lectures (traditional)
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]

sentences.english: Jingyan was the place set for emperors to study ling and history in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 中国古代经筵是为帝王研经读史而专设的御前讲席。

definition: Imperial College (or Academy), the highest educational body in imperial China
Imperial Hanlin Academy, lasting from Tang dynasty until 1911
members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
Imperial College of Supreme Learning, established in 124 BC, and the highest educational institute in ancient China until the Sui Dynasty
imperial exam involving writing essay on policy 策論|策论[ce4 lun4]
essay on policy in question and answer form used in imperial exams
same as 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1] Book of History
imperial censor (formal title of a dynastic official)
